description.en: This course consists of practice placement(s) and a Support Seminar, which scaffolds students' search for, completion of, and analysis of practice placement(s) as overseen by the practice tutor and the Support Seminar moderator.
description.et: See kursus koosneb praktikast ja toetusseminarist, mis abistab üliõpilasi praktikakohtade otsimisel, praktika läbimisel ja analüüsil ning mida juhivad praktikajuhendaja ja toetusseminari moderaator.

objectives.en:
This course is a space in which students apply the skills and knowledge taught in the Start and Philosophy in Application modules in an internship, traineeship, or work environment. The course thereby facilitates the cultivation of professional relationships, collaboration skills, and experience in potential future work environments. The practice placement has to fall into one of the following three categories: 

1) Practical experience in a work environment. The student will go, on the basis of a practice contract, outside the University to some organisation. They will be assigned a practice supervisor. They will perform the work tasks assigned to them by their place of practice. 

2) Project based practice. The student will participate in the work of a team within a specific project from beginning to end. The project must be either a response/solution to a specific need or a request by an organization outside the University, or a response/solution to a specific need or a request by a sub-unit of the University. This may include interdisciplinary projects listed in the FUTULAB initiative. NB: students are also encouraged to invent FUTULAB projects in collaboration with an interested staff member if they have a good idea for some such project (https://futulab.ut.ee/en/). 

3) Teaching assistant. The student will assist a faculty member with a course or research (incl. organising academic events).
objectives.et:
See kursus on koht, kus üliõpilased rakendavad stardimoodulis ja rakendusfilosoofia moodulis omandatud oskusi ja teadmisi praktikas. Kursus soodustab nõnda professionaalsete suhete arendamist, koostööoskuste kujundamist ja kogemuste omandamist võimalikes tulevastes töökeskkondades. 
Praktika peab kuuluma ühte järgmistest kolmest kategooriast: 

1) Praktiline koolitus ettevõttes. Üliõpilane läheb praktikalepingu alusel tööle mõnda asutusse väljaspool ülikooli. Talle määratakse praktikajuhendaja. Ta täidab oma praktikakoha poolt määratud tööülesandeid. 

2) Projektipõhine praktika. Tudeng osaleb ühe konkreetse projekti meeskonna töös projekti algusest lõpuni. Projekt peab olema vastus/lahendus konkreetsele vajadusele või ülikoolivälise asutuse või ka ülikooli allüksuse taotlusele. See võib hõlmata interdistsiplinaarseid projekte, mis on loetletud FUTULABi algatuses. NB: Julgustame üliõpilasi ka ise koostöös huvitatud asutuse/üksuse töötajatega FUTULABi projekte välja mõtlema, kui neil on selleks hea idee (https://futulab.ut.ee/en/). 

3) Õppeassistendi praktika. Tudeng assisteerib õppejõudu ühe konkreetse õppeaine läbiviimise või teadustöö tegemise juures (sh akadeemiliste ürituste korraldamine).

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the practice, the student:

- has experience in the process of identifying and applying to workplaces that allow them to apply: (a) the communication and argumentation skills acquired from the Start Module and Philosophy Module into practice in an internship, traineeship, or work environment; and (b) philosophical knowledge and skills acquired from the Start Module and Philosophy Module to solving problems in an internship, traineeship, or work environment;
learning_outcomes.et: - on saanud kogemuse selliste töökohtade leidmisel ja neile kandideerimisel, mis võimaldavad neil praktikas rakendada stardimoodulist ja rakendusfilosoofia moodulist saadud suhtlus- ja argumenteerimisoskusi ning filosoofilisi teadmisi ja probleemilahendusoskusi;

learning_outcomes.en: - has secured an agreement for a practice placement or a set of agreements for practice placements as described in the previous bullet point (these agreements must cover placement of an appropriate volume);
learning_outcomes.et: - on saavutanud kokkuleppe(d) lepingu sõlmimiseks ühe või mitme eelmises punktis kirjeldatud nõuetele vastava praktikakohaga (need lepingud kokku peavad katma praktikaaine mahu);

learning_outcomes.en: - has completed the practice placement(s) for which agreements have been secured;
learning_outcomes.et: - on sooritanud praktika(d), mille raames lepingud sõlmiti;

learning_outcomes.en: - has cultivated professional relationships, collaboration skills, and experience in environments they might consider for future career paths;
learning_outcomes.et: - on arendanud professionaalseid suhteid, koostööoskusi ja saanud kogemusi keskkondades, mida ta võib kaaluda oma tulevase karjääri tarbeks;

learning_outcomes.en: - has, after completion of their placement, shared their experience with the tutor for this course and fellow students;
learning_outcomes.et: - on pärast praktika lõpetamist jaganud oma kogemusi ülikoolipoolse juhendaja ja kaasõpilastega;

learning_outcomes.en: - has reflected on their experience and knows their strengths and weaknesses in relation to a practical work environment.
learning_outcomes.et: - on mõtisklenud oma kogemuste üle ja teab oma tugevusi ning nõrkusi seoses asjakohase töökeskkonnaga.

description.et:
To pass this course, students must: 
* Attend a Support Seminar, which occurs 3 times a semester until they have completed their practice placement and reported back to the Seminar on their experience.

* Complete small homework assignments for the Support Seminar, which coaches students through the process of identifying practice placements and drawing upon their experiences in their practice placements.
* Secure an agreement(s) for practice placement(s) of an adequate volume (templates available in Moodle).
* Complete practice placements of an adequate volume.
* Complete a practice report and timesheet (templates available in Moodle).

Students begin participating in a Support Seminar from their 2nd semester until they have completed their practice placement and reported on their experience back to the Support Seminar. 
The Support Seminar meets 3 times a semester. 
Support Seminar meetings take place in the 2nd, 8th, and 12th weeks of the semester. Independent work is continuous.
